Detailed Description

Internal association class for requests and responses related to an operation.

Warning;
This is an internal interface and must not be used outside APOXI at all. However, developers of Transport Adapters for APOXI OBEX will need to understand the concepts explained in the following paragraphs.

ObexOperationId instances serve as associations used by the OBEX API classes and Transport Adapters to associate requests and responses with an OBEX operation. Transport operations (opening and closing a transport connection) are also handled like OBEX operations since they follow the same asynchronous request-response pattern.

Concept:
The initiator of an operation (Transport Adapter for server operations, application interface for client operations) allocates a new ObexOperationId by calling the named constructor Create() and stores it in a member variable. It is then used as parameter to all calls made to ObexProtocol and ObexLayer or further derived classes. An ObexOperationId represents the OBEX operation which can be exclusively pending on one transport connection represented by ObexChannel. At the end of each client- or server operation, ObexProtocol::OnComplete() is called passing the ObexOperationId as a parameter for the last time. After completion of an operation the Transport Adapter should immediatly invalidate the stored ObexOperationId by calling Invalidate() on it. When the application interface receives the ObexMsg indicating the operation result, it should clean up any state information related to the operation. This includes invalidating the stored ObexOperationId.
